page.title: 18Local Government, Beckenham
page.content: Beckenham had an Urban District Council until the re-organisation of local government in London in 1963, when it became part of the new London Borough of Bromley. As one of the outer London Boroughs, Bromley comes under the authority of the G.L.C. for major matters, but has responsibility for its own services including education, refuse collection, libraries, etc. The so-called 'Old Council Offices' are used for public meetings, exhibitions, and for general hire. The Town Hall in Beckenham is not required by Bromley Borough Council and at the moment is being used by the Citizens Advice Bureau. At this time we are waiting to see if the proposed abolition of the G.L.c. will affect services provided in this area.
